info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 7:04PM CDT until March 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR LEE... SOUTHEASTERN ST. FRANCIS...NORTHEASTERN PHILLIPS...SOUTHWESTERN CRITTENDEN AND NORTHERN TUNICA COUNTIES... At 704 PM CDT, a confirmed large and extremely dangerous tornado was located over Lexa, or near St Francis National Park, moving east at 55 mph. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. TAKE COVER NOW! HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Weather spotters confirmed tornado. At 659 PM CDT, a storm chaser reported tornado 2 miles east of Marvell. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be destroyed. Considerable damage to homes, businesses, and vehicles is likely and complete destruction is possible. Locations impacted include... Marianna, Hughes, Tunica, Horseshoe Lake, Lexa, Rondo, Aubrey, Anthonyville, Simsboro, Brickeys, North Tunica, Pinckney, Robinsonville, Lagrange, Cody, Clack, Haleside, Commerce, Austin and Soudan. TORNADO...OBSERVED TORNADO DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a large, extremely dangerous and potentially deadly tornado is on the ground. To protect your life, TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
